Such a mode of reasoning, though recommended by the respectable authority of William of St. Amour‚ and adopted without any suspicion by modern historiam, would have seemed monstrous and incredible, were it not as fashionable in this nineteenth century as in the thir- teenth‚ only substituting for the friars any body of Christians more than usually active, and therefore particularly obnoxious.
